article_title: The Regulatory Impact Of President Obama's Final Year
article_text:
The Regulatory Impact Of President Obama's Final Year

Law360, New York (March 8, 2016, 9:22 AM ET) -- Last year saw an overwhelming tide of action by the executive branch — a continued expansion of the unilateral exercise of power that has characterized the Obama administration for much of its tenure. Whether or not one agrees with this president’s policies, it has been impressive in the way he has marshaled his resources to get things done. Now, as we enter the last year of an eight-year presidency, there is a lot of unfinished business and an appetite in the executive branch to “make hay...

To view the full article, register now.

article_metadata.description: Whether or not one agrees with this president’s policies, it has been impressive how he has marshaled his resources to get things done. Now, as we enter the last year of an eight-year presidency, there is a lot of unfinished business and an appetite in the executive branch to “make hay while the sun shines.” And there will be little to stand in the administration’s way, say attorneys with Crowell & Moring LLP.
